channel.title: Numpy on Sarthak Jariwala
channel.description: Recent content in Numpy on Sarthak Jariwala

item.title: Pad Numpy Array
item.description: Preliminaries import numpy as np # create an array a = np.array([1, 2, -1]) Pad array on both sides with constant values Add two 3’s to the left of the array and four -7’s to the right of the array. np.pad(a, (2, 4), "constant", constant_values=(3, -7)) # array([ 3, 3, 1, 2, -1, -7, -7, -7, -7]) Pad array on only one side But, what if you only want to pad the right side or left side?

item.title: Swap Axes in Array
item.description: Preliminary # load library import numpy as np Create a multi-dimensional array m = np.zeros(shape=(100, 32, 50)) Swap dimensions # swap axis 1 and 2 with each other in array `m` m_swapped = np.swapaxes(m, 1, 2) # view the shape m_swapped.shape (100, 50, 32)
